form.official-title: To amend section 349 of the Immigration and Nationality Act to deem specified activities in support of terrorism as renunciation of United States nationality.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Expatriate Terrorists Act.

section.header: Loss of nationality due to support of terrorism
section.text: Section 349(a) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1481(a)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking or at the end;

subparagraph.text: by striking or a political subdivision thereof and inserting , a political subdivision thereof, or a designated foreign terrorist organization; and
by striking or at the end;
in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking if and inserting or a designated foreign terrorist organization if—;
in subparagraph (A), by striking , or and inserting or intentionally targeting nationals of the United States for acts of terror; or; and
in subparagraph (B), by striking or at the end;

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (4), (5), (6), and (7) as paragraphs (5), (6), (7), and (8), respectively;
by inserting after paragraph (3) the following:
becoming a member of, or providing training or material assistance to, any designated foreign terrorist organization that such person knows, or has reason to know—

subparagraph.text: will engage in hostilities against the United States; or
will commit acts of terror against the United States or nationals of the United States;
in subparagraph (A), by striking he and inserting the person knowingly; and
in subparagraph (B), by striking allegiance is required; or and inserting allegiance to the foreign state or political subdivision is required;; and

paragraph.text: in paragraph (6), as redesignated, by striking or at the end.
